questions.question_text: What does a unit test typically check?
questions.options_json: {"A": "The entire system's functionality", "B": "A single unit of code's behavior in isolation", "C": "The performance of the system under load", "D": "The security vulnerabilities in the code"}
questions.explanation: Unit tests check a small part of the code to ensure it behaves as expected. This helps catch bugs early and prevent them from propagating throughout the system.

questions.question_text: What is the primary purpose of a unit test?
questions.options_json: {"A": "To verify that an entire application works as expected", "B": "To ensure individual units of code are working correctly", "C": "To catch errors in the compiler", "D": "To optimize code for better performance"}
questions.explanation: Unit tests focus on verifying that small, isolated pieces of code (units) behave as expected. This helps ensure that changes to the codebase do not introduce bugs.

questions.question_text: What is the primary purpose of a mock object in unit testing?
questions.options_json: {"A": "To test the integration between multiple units of code", "B": "To isolate dependencies and make individual units easier to test", "C": "To verify the correctness of a single unit of code in isolation", "D": "To reduce the number of test cases required for a given feature"}
questions.explanation: A mock object is used to isolate dependencies and make individual units easier to test, allowing developers to focus on one unit at a time. This makes it easier to identify and fix issues in the code.

questions.question_text: What is a key benefit of using mocking libraries in unit testing?
questions.options_json: {"A": "To test complex interactions between multiple classes", "B": "To isolate dependencies and make tests more reliable", "C": "To reduce the number of test cases needed", "D": "To improve code coverage"}
questions.explanation: Mocking libraries allow you to isolate dependencies, making your tests more reliable by controlling the inputs and outputs. This is particularly useful when testing complex interactions between multiple classes.

questions.question_text: What is the primary purpose of a mock object in unit testing?
questions.options_json: {"A": "To test the integration between multiple units of code", "B": "To isolate dependencies and make individual units testable", "C": "To increase code coverage by testing more lines of code", "D": "To reduce the number of tests needed for a given piece of code"}
questions.explanation: A mock object is used to isolate dependencies and make individual units testable, allowing developers to focus on one unit at a time. This makes it easier to write targeted tests that cover specific functionality.
